summary: jon x ygritte playlist Cloud - Elias Discoloration - Dawn Golden This Is How I Let You Down - The Franklin Electric I Need My...
body:
jon x ygritte playlist

  1. Cloud - Elias
  2. Discoloration - Dawn Golden
  3. This Is How I Let You Down - The Franklin Electric
  4. I Need My Girl - The National
  5. Plane vs. Tank vs. Submarine - Tiger’s Jaw
  6. The Night We Met - Lord Huron
  7. Save the World - Wolfie’s Just Fine
  8. Let Me Follow - Son Lux
  9. Pusher - alt-J
  10. The Cold - Exitmusic

tags: the food and the Tarly's are irrelevant to the notion and their lords
stop trying to make fetch happen
body:
The Food and The Tarly’s

Why would the North and the NL’s care about the Tarly’s dying and the food getting burnt? The North as I understand is now an independent state that has broken away from the 7 kingdom with their own king(Jon Snow). The food getting burnt does not affect them in any way. Am of the understanding that since the North broke away from the 7 kingdom they would not be getting any aid from Cersei in the form of food or soldiers,so why would they care about Cersei not getting enough food to hoard? They are currently at odds with Cersie and they dont recognize her as their Queen. They were never gonna get that food for their people,so this should not concern them. They govern themselves now and any aid they want will have to come from the people who are loyal to the KITN and house Stark.

The only person in the North who is going to care about the Tarly’s dying is Sam. Why would the North or the NL’s care about soldiers dying in a war that has nothing to do with them? The Tarly’s weren’t fighting for the North,they were fighting for Cersei who they hate as much as the Targaryen’s. If anything,those soldiers dying weakens Cersei’s manpower that could be used to attack the North. She pretty much told Jon she was going to attack the North in the scroll she sent him if he did not bend the knee.

The North and the NL’s are more likely to be upset about Dany because she is a Targaryen(as has been shown in season 7) and she has two Dragons. Two soldiers who was not fighting their war and died and food getting burnt that was going to feed their enemy is not gonna be their concern.

tags: You may not have my name but you have my blood
Jon Snow will choose his Stark identity
Jon Snow will not choose his Targaryen heritage
summary: Jon Snow will choose to be a Stark.
title: Jon Snow will choose to be a Stark.
body: “All my life I wanted to be a Stark.” ~ Jon Snow

reblog.comment: “All my life I wanted to be a Stark.” ~ Jon Snow

trail.content_raw: “All my life I wanted to be a Stark.” ~ Jon Snow

I write imagines and one shots. Feel free to request whatever you wish. I'm happy if want to submit a one-shot that you have written for me to post. {Requests are open!}

blog.name: nat111love
blog.description:
Nat. Self-proclaimed TV addict. Fangirl.

summary: haaaaaaaaaaaah l knew it... that’s what l’ve been saying since forever she loves him and she knows it l mean that was so obvious...
body:
haaaaaaaaaaaah l knew it… that’s what l’ve been saying since forever she loves him and she knows it l mean that was so obvious the  “l wish jon were here”, the  “what does that have to do with anything” “you think he wants to marry her” to littlefinger in season 7…

 that girl  was already in love and ready to  commit incest . 

Sansa asking jon if he bent the knee for love or for the north could be perceived as her just wanted to know if he was dumb enough to bend the knee for  love or because he thought that was the only way to save the north….

when the real motive behind that question is to know if dany took that important place she had in his life and the one she is secretly hoping  she has in his heart .

blog.name: thelawyerthatwaspromised
blog.title: The Lawyer That Was Promised
blog.description: “You may burn us, my lady … but you will not bend us, break us, or make us bow. This is Dorne. You are not wanted here. Return at your peril.”

title: Jon Snow is the anti-Stannis
body:
For reasons unknown, there seems to be a popular opinion in the fandom that Jon Snow is basically Stannis Baratheon with a little more charm.

It bothered me for awhile as I see Jon just completely different from Stannis. Then it hit me: it largely comes from this assessment of Jon and Stannis by Mel.

Mel says that Jon and Stannis were both:

“Living in the shadows of their older brothers.”

 She’s wrong. The relationship between Robb-Jon and Robert-Stannis couldn’t be much more different.

Jon calls Robb his rival and best friend and constant companion.

Whereas Stannis was constantly expressing jealousy of his brother.

Like when he complains that Robert had a skill for making friends and inspiring loyalty while Stannis is utterly hopeless in that regard.

Jon also wasn’t truly “overshadowed” by Robb. He didn’t have an inferiority complex - he was Robb’s most worthy competitor, in fact:

Jon frequently bested Robb in their brotherly competitions as kids. This was one of the main reasons why Catelyn felt so threatened by him.

Jon and Robb actually much more resemble Ned and Robert, especially given the irony that Jon and Robb aren’t brothers but are still brothers.

Robert loved the idea of being Ned’s brother by law. Ned was the brother he chose. 

Hey…if Jon and Sansa are wed, I suppose that becomes true for Jon and Robb, doesn’t it?

Meanwhile, Stannis is unable to even say he truly loves Robert.

Not even as a courtesy.

Mel totally doesn’t understand Jon.

“Both men were unbelievers by nature.”

This is also way way off. At least Mel seems to have an accurate idea of who Stannis is..but Jon?

Jon may express wishes for more direct communication with the old gods at times…but he’s always properly respectful of them and this passage from Dance makes Jon appear downright pious in the moment.

Not to mention the religious undertones through Jon’s connection to the old gods through Ghost. 

If Jon is a part of Ghost, and Ghost belongs to the old gods, it’s no small wonder where Jon’s heart lies. The gods of the Northmen are constantly in Jon’s thoughts and one of the main connections he uses both internally and externally to bridge the gap between Westeros and the Free Folk.

“The only gods they truly worshipped were honor and duty.”

Wow, Mel. Considering a significant portion of Jon’s story is marked by Jon compromising both his own honor and feeling conflicted in his duties, I’m not sure she could be much far from the truth.

There are tons of passages of Jon questioning his own honor…but what’s one of the central “questions” of the series? It’s the question of what you would do when faced with a choice between love and honor. Love is framed as incompatible with Honor and Duty. So where does Jon stand on love?

Jon thinks frequently about Ygritte. He thinks about what he could do to win Val’s love, if he chose. He expresses love for his family back home time and time again. 

Jon is even faced with the idea that Love as being incompatible with Honor and Duty by one of the wisest people in the series…and Jon has fundamentally different thoughts on the matter altogether:

Though Jon wanted to be respectful, he didn’t agree in his heart that Love was such a bad thing. To Jon, sacrificing certain portions of his honor and maybe interpreting his duties unconventionally can be worth it if it’s in service of protecting people…and how else can the instinct of “protection” be characterized other than an act of “love” at its root?

What gives Jon such an advantage over people who he must deal with (some having massive power advantages like Mance and Stannis) is their constant inability to properly assess Jon’s thought processes and how he often is practicing his own forms of manipulation while they assume he is carbon copy of the honorable and constantly truth Ned Stark; itself a big misnomer knowing the huge lies Ned told the world.

This is what makes Jon one of the most interesting and misunderstood characters in the series to me. It’s not that he’s the perfect hero. He’s not. He schemes because he must. Kills when he must. Lies when he must. But it’s not in pursuit of power or greed. He does what he needs to do to protect people. He loves his family. He’s constantly measuring his responses and managing egos. He’s Ned’s foolish honorable bastard to one person - and a scheming traitorous criminal to another. 

All the while other characters miss the mark and fail to understand what really guides Jon Snow. 

Mel’s assertions (which are taken as canonically true by a lot of people) perfectly illustrate this misunderstanding.

tags: do you love her or nah!!
sansa fierce is on her way ….and she wants her man back
summary: Jon: l’m sorry l bent the knee...but the war the white walkers l had... sansa: white what?!… please jon  that’s not really the...
body:
Jon: l’m sorry l bent the knee…but the war the white walkers l had…

sansa: white what?!… please jon  that’s not really the point here …. did you bend the knee because you love her….. the only relevant question today is do you love her ?!

summary: Why Jon claim is superior (under westerosi law) to Daenarys
title: Why Jon claim is superior (under westerosi law) to Daenarys
body:
Hi Tumblr these days I have seen many posts discussing who had the greatest right to the throne among our favorites Jon and Dany and so I decided to do another of my long posts that nobody will read to make a little bit of clarity.

Westeros as far as G.R.R. Martin has let us understand is a feudal monarchy copied from the European ones around 1300, this thing is very important because this information plus the peace treaty that followed the dance of the dragons makes us understand that the westerosi follow the Salica law or a similar to it. The Salica law was written around 500 d.c. by the Frankish king Clodovedo and then expanded into the Carolingian era, this law clearly declared that the land shall not be innheart by women of the family and that only son could have the land , certainly over time there were enormous changes due to political reasons, see the accession to the throne of Queen Mary of Scotland and later of her sister Elizabeth ascended the throne following the death of their younger brother, but this there were no other male members of their dynasty who could claim the throne. Typically the situation went like this: first the male sons, second the male members of the dynasty, third the male members of cadets of the family (see succession to the grand duchy of Tuscany 1700), for last the females of the family. 

This will change with the Pragmatic Sanction in the 18th century with which the emperor of Austria declared that on his death his daughter Caterina would inherit the empire, so his dynasty would not have died out. This provoked a war ( ok the fact that the prussian were invading saxoni was a good reason but the official casus belli was Caterin ) that finally saw the prevailing forces of Caterina who became the first female ruler of Austria.

This we can also apply to the world of GOT, after the death of both Rhaegar and Aerys, Queen Rhaella will declare the young Prince Viserys king, even if Viserys had indeed been king (and this is unlikely since he received no legal formalization, Rhaella’s decision was not completely power law) at his death the title should pass first to the male of the nearest dynasty, in this case Jon, and only in case of Jon’s death and with a council (I follow the European medieval tradition) the title would pass to Daenarys.

I hope I explained to you if you have any questions, please write .


Sempre vostro Luca097

summary: If I have to bet what will happen in episode2 after Friki’s spoilers, I’ll say that the first part of the episode will be angsty...
body: If I have to bet what will happen in episode2 after Friki’s spoilers, I’ll say that the first part of the episode will be angsty as hell between Jon and Dany but by almost the end of the episode they will fuck! I’m like 70% sure of this. And then the horn will sound and the episode will end with the army approaching (golden company or AofD I don’t remember who’s supposed to attack first).
